dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Zhao, H. 2011. Cobitis arenae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Recorded from the Pearl River basin (Dong Jiang and Xi Jiang, and Western Lake, Hwei-yang), Guangdong Province, China, Asia. Also recorded from the Xi Jiang in Guanxi Province.

A record from the Hong River basin in Viet Nam required confirmation; most likely a different species.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Asia:  China (Ref. 33389) and northern Viet Nam (Ref. 44416).

dataObjects.description:
Habitat and Ecology
A bottom-dwelling species, with sandy and stony bottom and flowing water.

Systems
  • Freshwater

dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Zhao, H. 2011. Cobitis arenae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
DD
Data Deficient

Red List Criteria

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2011

Assessor/s
Zhao, H.

Reviewer/s
Allen, D.J., Chen, X.-Y., Zhou, W. & Cui, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The species is known from the Dong Jiang and Xi Jiang basins in southern China. Little is known of the species population trends, however it is known to have a small population (Zheng 1989).

It is assessed as Data Deficient, and further research is required.

Major Threats
Pollution form agriculture is a potential threat to this species.
